channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5048] camel-odata quickstart fails to install on jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-025
item.description:
osgi:install -s mvn:org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse/camel-odata/6.3.0.redhat-025 results in the error below: (in the log)

2016-02-29 15:56:37,635 | ERROR | l Console Thread | BlueprintContainerImpl | 23 - org.apache.aries.blueprint.core - 1.4.4 | Unable to start blueprint container for bundle org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse.camel-odata/6.3.0.redhat-025

item.summary: camel-odata quickstart fails to install on jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-025

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Created upstream issue ARIES-1544 in Blueprint to support setters with derived type parameters.
For now the the component can be fixed by adding a getter, since Camel insists on overriding the setter for documentation mojo.
Created upstream Camel issue CAMEL-9941 for a workaround for the blueprint issue in the Olingo2 component.
Fixed with commit https://github.com/jboss-fuse/camel/commit/ddd121e68fbeac899b81daecbcc06c56565ae5d8 cherry-picked from upstream
The same error happens in camel-linkedin quickstart

Fixed for LinkedIn component with commit https://github.com/jboss-fuse/camel/commit/5baa0743bbb548b0603364cbc11c2e419725fb85 cherry-picked from upstream. The underlying Blueprint issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-1544 needs to be addressed for any new Camel components.
Dhiraj Bokde Hi, I verified the Odata and Linkedin fix in 6.3.0.redhat-131, but I found out the camel-salesfoce and camel-box has the same issue. Can it be fixed too?

Hi Jan Kasztura, I've fixed this issue for box, google drive and google mail components with https://github.com/jboss-fuse/camel/commit/41b9d2c153436043c3a78238fe4b7357a827c478.
Since the camel salesforce component doesn't use the same API component framework, it doesn't seem to be the same issue. Can you provide a stack trace of where this exception is occurring in your testing?
Sorry, it looks like there was a problem with my test, not with camel-salesforce. I will verify the fix in next builds.
Can this one be marked as resolved?
I think so. Odata and Linkedin are fixed in ER2, I will verify the rest in next build
